document.title: Illinois Learning Standards for English Language Arts

9E257470DFE501317AA568A86D17958E.description: Use print, nonprint, human and technological resources to acquire and use information.

9E25BAE0DFE501317AA668A86D17958E.description: Write letters, reports and stories based on acquired information.

9E252540DFE501317AA468A86D17958E.description: Apply acquired information, concepts and ideas to communicate in a variety of formats.

9E24D260DFE501317AA368A86D17958E.description: Select and organize information from various sources for a specific purpose.

9E243C70DFE501317AA168A86D17958E.description: Analyze and evaluate information acquired from various sources.

9E239470DFE501317A9F68A86D17958E.description: Locate information using a variety of resources.

9E234A90DFE501317A9E68A86D17958E.description: Locate, organize, and use information from various sources to answer questions, solve problems and communicate ideas.

comments: To be successful in school and in the world of work, students must be able to use a wide variety of information resources (written, visual and electronic). They must also know how to frame questions for inquiry, identify and organize relevant information and communicate it effectively in a variety of formats. These skills are critical in school across all learning areas and are key to successful career and lifelong learning experiences.
9E22F900DFE501317A9D68A86D17958E.description: Use the language arts to acquire, assess and communicate information.

9E2688E0DFE501317AA968A86D17958E.description: Participate in discussions around a common topic.

9E26D560DFE501317AAA68A86D17958E.description: Present brief oral reports, using language and vocabulary appropriate to the message and audience (e.g., show and tell).

9E264690DFE501317AA868A86D17958E.description: Speak effectively using language appropriate to the situation and audience.

9E27C570DFE501317AAD68A86D17958E.description: Use visually oriented and auditorily based media.

9E277A30DFE501317AAC68A86D17958E.description: Ask questions and respond to questions from the teacher and from group members to improve comprehension.

9E280930DFE501317AAE68A86D17958E.description: Listen attentively by facing the speaker, making eye contact and paraphrasing what is said.

9E272F90DFE501317AAB68A86D17958E.description: Listen effectively in formal and informal situations.

9E25FF90DFE501317AA768A86D17958E.description: Listen and speak effectively in a variety of situations.
comments: Of all the language arts, listening and speaking are those most often used on a daily basis at home, school and work or in the community. Skill in speaking is universally recognized as a primary indicator of a person's knowledge, skill and credibility. In person, by phone or through video, good listening and speaking skills are essential to sending, receiving and understanding messages. To understand messages spoken by others, students must be able to listen carefully, using specific techniques to clarify what they have heard. For speaking properly and making messages understood, grammar, sentence structure, tone, expression and emphasis must be part of students' repertoires.

9E1AE390DFE501317A8068A86D17958E.description: Create media compositions or productions which convey meaning visually for a variety of purposes.

9E1B3410DFE501317A8168A86D17958E.description: Write for a variety of purposes including description, information, explanation, persuasion and narration.

9E1A8F30DFE501317A7F68A86D17958E.description: Communicate ideas in writing to accomplish a variety of purposes.

9E19F190DFE501317A7D68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate focus, organization, elaboration and integration in written compositions (e.g., short stories, letters, essays, reports).

9E1A3FB0DFE501317A7E68A86D17958E.description: Use prewriting strategies to generate and organize ideas (e.g., focus on one topic; organize writing to include a beginning, middle and end; use descriptive words when writing about people, places, things, events).

9E199B10DFE501317A7C68A86D17958E.description: Compose well-organized and coherent writing for specific purposes and audiences.

9E1BB530DFE501317A8368A86D17958E.description: Construct complete sentences which demonstrate subject/verb agreement; appropriate capitalization and punctuation; correct spelling of appropriate, high-frequency words; and appropriate use of the eight parts of speech.

9E1B7630DFE501317A8268A86D17958E.description: Use correct grammar, spelling, punctuation, capitalization and structure.

9E193D90DFE501317A7B68A86D17958E.description: Write to communicate for a variety of purposes.
comments: The ability to write clearly is essential to any person's effective communications. Students with high-level writing skills can produce documents that show planning and organization and effectively convey the intended message and meaning. Clear writing is critical to employment and production in today's world. Individuals must be capable of writing for a variety of audiences in differing styles, including standard rhetoric themes, business letters and reports, financial proposals and technical and professional communications. Students should be able to use word processors and computers to enhance their writing proficiency and improve their career opportunities.

9E1DC1B0DFE501317A8B68A86D17958E.description: Relate character, setting and plot to real-life situations.

9E1D8380DFE501317A8A68A86D17958E.description: Identify common themes in literature from a variety of eras.

9E1E00E0DFE501317A8C68A86D17958E.description: Respond to literary materials by connecting them to their own experience and communicate those responses to others.

9E1D4580DFE501317A8968A86D17958E.description: Read and interpret a variety of literary works.

9E1C6F30DFE501317A8668A86D17958E.description: Describe differences between prose and poetry.

9E1CBD60DFE501317A8768A86D17958E.description: Classify literary works as fiction or nonfiction.

9E1D05F0DFE501317A8868A86D17958E.description: Identify the literary elements of theme, setting, plot and character within literary works.

9E1C3300DFE501317A8568A86D17958E.description: Understand how literary elements and techniques are used to convey meaning.

9E1BF340DFE501317A8468A86D17958E.description: Read and understand literature representative of various societies, eras and ideas.
comments: Literature transmits ideas, reflects societies and eras and expresses the human imagination. It brings understanding, enrichment and joy. Appreciating literature and recognizing its many forms enable students to learn and respond to ideas, issues, perspectives and actions of others. Literature study includes understanding the structure and intent of a short poem or a long, complex book. By exploring the techniques that authors use to convey messages and evoke responses, students connect literature to their own lives and daily experiences.

9E1F53B0DFE501317A9068A86D17958E.description: Use information presented in simple tables, maps and charts to form an interpretation.

9E1F01C0DFE501317A8F68A86D17958E.description: Identify how authors and illustrators express their ideas in text and graphics (e.g., dialogue, conflict, shape, color, characters).

9E208FB0DFE501317A9468A86D17958E.description: Summarize content of reading material using text organization (e.g., story, sequence).

9E204BC0DFE501317A9368A86D17958E.description: Use information to form questions and verify predictions.

9E1EBA90DFE501317A8E68A86D17958E.description: Comprehend a broad range of reading materials.

9E219BE0DFE501317A9868A86D17958E.description: Read age-appropriate material aloud with fluency and accuracy.

9E2151A0DFE501317A9768A86D17958E.description: Continuously check and clarify for understanding (e.g., reread, read ahead, use visual and context clues, ask questions, retell, use meaningful substitutions).

9E211000DFE501317A9668A86D17958E.description: Identify genres (forms and purposes) of fiction, nonfiction, poetry and electronic literary forms.

9E21E590DFE501317A9968A86D17958E.description: Establish purposes for reading, make predictions, connect important ideas, and link text to previous experiences and knowledge.

9E20CFA0DFE501317A9568A86D17958E.description: Apply reading strategies to improve understanding and fluency.

9E22B2A0DFE501317A9C68A86D17958E.description: Comprehend unfamiliar words using context clues and prior knowledge; verify meanings with resource materials.

9E226F50DFE501317A9B68A86D17958E.description: Apply word analysis skills (e.g., phonics, word patterns) to recognize new words.

9E222C20DFE501317A9A68A86D17958E.description: Apply word analysis and vocabulary skills to comprehend selections.

comments: Reading is essential. It is the process by which people gain information and ideas from books, newspapers, manuals, letters, contracts, advertisements and a host of other materials. Using strategies for constructing meaning before, during and after reading will help students connect what they read now with what they have learned in the past. Students who read well and widely build a strong foundation for learning in all areas of life.
